public.name: Preliminaries
public.html: You can complete and submit these questions before the exam starts.
public.tex: You can complete and submit these questions before the exam starts.
public.text: You can complete and submit these questions before the exam starts.

questions.tex: What is your student ID number?
questions.text: What is your student ID number?

groups.name: Exam Name Question One
groups.html: This is your name. This is some very important text. This text is not so important.
groups.tex:
This is your name. \emph{This is some very important text}. This text is
not so important.
groups.text: This is your name. *This is some very important text*. This text is not so important.

questions.html: Your name. These are some multiple choice questions. You must select exactly one.
questions.tex:
Your name. These are some multiple choice questions. You must select
exactly one.
questions.text: Your name. These are some multiple choice questions. You must select exactly one.

options.tex: Or your name can even be \texttt{code}!
options.text: Or your name can even be `code`!

questions.tex: This is a short answer question.
questions.text: This is a short answer question.

groups.name: Another Exam Question
groups.tex: This is another block of questions.
groups.text: This is another block of questions.

questions.html: \(\LaTeX\) display math is also supported \[ \int_{0}^\infty e^{-x^2 / 2} \, \mathrm{d}x \]
questions.tex:
\(\LaTeX\) display math is also supported \[
    \int_{0}^\infty e^{-x^2 / 2} \, \mathrm{d}x
\]
questions.text:
$\LaTeX$ display math is also supported
$$
    \int_{0}^\infty e^{-x^2 / 2} \, \mathrm{d}x
$$

questions.html:
You can also include large code blocks in questions

m, t = Day(), Week(199)
t.mask(200)(100)(150)(160)
Day.aqi = 140
t.aqi = 160

And allow code in answers too
questions.tex:
You can also include large code blocks in questions

\begin{verbatim}
m, t = Day(), Week(199)
t.mask(200)(100)(150)(160)
Day.aqi = 140
t.aqi = 160
\end{verbatim}

And allow code in answers too
questions.text:
You can also include large code blocks in questions
```
m, t = Day(), Week(199)
t.mask(200)(100)(150)(160)
Day.aqi = 140
t.aqi = 160
```

And allow code in answers too

questions.html:
You can omit point values for particular questions, if you want.

Paragraph answers are allowed. You can even specify the number of lines displayed! This block is four lines long.
questions.tex:
You can omit point values for particular questions, if you want.

Paragraph answers are allowed. You can even specify the number of lines
displayed! This block is four lines long.
questions.text:
You can omit point values for particular questions, if you want.

Paragraph answers are allowed. You can even specify the number of lines displayed! This block is four lines long.

questions.html:
Images and other markdown features should all be supported. If it works on GitHub, it should work here.

Stuff

Tables Are Cool
col 3 is right-aligned $1600
col 2 is centered $12
zebra stripes are neat $1
questions.tex:
Images and other markdown features should all be supported. If it works
on GitHub, it should work here.

\hypertarget{stuff}{%
\subsection{Stuff}\label{stuff}}

\includegraphics{https://github.com/adam-p/markdown-here/raw/master/src/common/images/icon48.png}

\begin{longtable}[]{@{}lcr@{}}
\toprule
Tables & Are & Cool\tabularnewline
\midrule
\endhead
col 3 is & right-aligned & \$1600\tabularnewline
col 2 is & centered & \$12\tabularnewline
zebra stripes & are neat & \$1\tabularnewline
\bottomrule
\end{longtable}
questions.text:
Images and other markdown features should all be supported. If it works on GitHub, it should work here.

## Stuff

![](https://github.com/adam-p/markdown-here/raw/master/src/common/images/icon48.png "Logo Title Text 1")

| Tables        | Are           | Cool  |
| ------------- |:-------------:| -----:|
| col 3 is      | right-aligned | $1600 |
| col 2 is      | centered      |   $12 |
| zebra stripes | are neat      |    $1 |
